title: Security interest arising in purchase or delivery of
context: ยง490:9-206 Security interest arising in purchase or delivery of financial asset. (a) A security interest in favor of a securities intermediary attaches to a person&rsquo;s security entitlement if: (1) The person buys a financial asset through the securities intermediary in a transaction in which the person is obligated to pay the purchase price to the securities intermediary at the time of the purchase; and (2) The securities intermediary credits the financial asset to the buyer&rsquo;s securities account before the buyer pays the securities intermediary. (b) The security interest described in subsection (a) secures the person&rsquo;s obligation to pay for the financial asset. &copy; A security interest in favor of a person that delivers a certificated security or other financial asset represented by a writing attaches to the security or other financial asset if: (1) The security or other financial asset: (A) In the ordinary course of business is transferred by delivery with any necessary indorsement or assignment; and (B) Is delivered under an agreement between persons in the business of dealing with such securities or financial assets; and (2) The agreement calls for delivery against payment. (d) The security interest described in subsection &copy; secures the obligation to make payment for the delivery. [L 2000, c 241, pt of ยง1]
